body.p: Restores the value of a system configuration parameter to the default value.

section.title: Description
section.p: RESET restores system configuration parameters to their default values. RESET is an alternative spelling for SET configuration_parameter TO DEFAULT.

The default value is defined as the value that the parameter would have had, had no SET ever been issued for it in the current session. The actual source of this value might be a compiled-in default, the master postgresql.conf configuration file, command-line options, or per-database or per-user default settings. See for more information.

plentry.pd: The name of a system configuration parameter. See for details.
Resets all settable configuration parameters to their default values.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Set the statement_mem configuration parameter to its default value:

section.title: Compatibility
section.p: RESET is a Greenplum Database extension.
